record.description: Lawrence H. Lanzl of the Department of Radiology, Argonne Cancer Research Hospital, (operated by the University of Chicago under contract with the U.S. Atomic Energy Commission) uses a set of master-slave manipulators (mechanical hands) to hold a tiny capsule of aluminum (left of picture) containing 15 radioactive cobalt wafers. These wafers, irradiated at the National Reactor Testing Station in Idaho, will be used in cancer control research. Lanzl and members of the Remote Control Engineering Division of Argonne National Laboratory, Lemont, are preparing the cobalt wafers for insertion into a radiotherapy machine.
